questions.description: AC current can be generated by :

AC is not used in :
(a) Electroplating	
(b) Battery charging  
(c) Capacitor charging
(d) Electrolysis
(e) Room heating

Statement-I : The average value for one cycle of alternating is zero.
Statement-II : The total charge flowing in circuit in one cycle is zero.

options.description: Statement-I is correct and statement-II is incorrect.
Statement-I is incorrect and statement-II is correct.

questions.description:
Choose false statement :
(a) ac metre can measures DC
(b) If AC meter measures DC then scale should be linear and uniform 
(c) both AC and DC meter are based on thermal effect of current 
(d) AC meter measures RMS value of current
AC cannot be measured by DC ammeter, because :

options.description: AC cannot flow through DC ammeter
average value of AC over a complete cycle is zero

questions.description: H/Ω is equivalent :

Assertion : In a circuit consisting of pure inductor, the value of current flowing decreases with increasing the frequency of conductor.
Reason : The inductive load decreases as the frequency increases.

options.description: Both Assertion & Reason are True & the Reason  is a correct explanation of the Assertion.
Both Assertion & Reason are True but Reason is not a correct explanation of the Assertion.
Assertion is True but the Reason is False.

questions.description:
Assertion : The alternating current legs behind the emf by a phase angle of π/2 when AC flows through the inductor.
Reason : The inductive reactance is increases as the frequency of AC source decreases.

options.description: Both Assertion & Reason are True & the Reason  is a correct explanation of the Assertion.
Both Assertion & Reason are True but Reason is not a correct explanation of the Assertion.
Assertion is True but the Reason is False.

questions.description: The band width of a series resonant circuit is 500Hz and the resonant frequency is 5000Hz. The quality factor of the circuit will be :
For high frequency, a capacitor offers :

Assertion : In a circuit consisting of a pure capacitor, the value of current flowing increases with increasing the frequency of the conductor.
Reason : Capacitive reactance decreases with increasing frequency.

options.description: Both Assertion & Reason are True & the Reason  is a correct explanation of the Assertion.
Both Assertion & Reason are True but Reason is not a correct explanation of the Assertion.
Assertion is True but the Reason is False.

questions.description:
Assertion : Capacitor serves as a block for DC and offers an easy path for AC at high frequency.
Reason : Capacitive reactance is inversely proportional to frequency.

options.description: Both Assertion & Reason are True & the Reason  is a correct explanation of the Assertion.
Both Assertion & Reason are True but Reason is not a correct explanation of the Assertion.
Assertion is True but the Reason is False.
